page.title: 04THE ANGLICAN CHURCH
page.content: The church of {St Paul} was built as a chapel-of-ease in 1890 at the expense of the dowager Duchess of Northumberland. Prior to this, the Anglican parishioners, who were largely employees or tenants of the Stanwick Estate, had to walk to Stanwick Church some 1\ miles distant in order to attend Sunday services. Today, only one Vicar is instituted to look after the parishes & churches of Aldbrough, Stanwick, Forcett and East Layton. He is assisted on occasions, mainly by retired clergy such as the Rev. Canon T.A. Littleton who lives locally. Rev. Keith Atherley has just been inducted as Vicar and has come to live in the new Vicarage at Aldbrough. Prior to this, previous incumbents lived at Stanwick Vicarage. That house was sold at auction around April this year.
